Quality Change?. I first ordered People Socks in Jan 2020. They were amazing - super soft and comfortable. I placed two more orders in the next month.

As I have basically lived in these socks through COVID they have become a little scratchy. I didn't realize that its not the best approach to dry them in the dryer. as it changes the character of the fabric. So, I ordered more.

The new socks arrived yesterday and they just aren't the same quality as they were less than a year ago. They are tight. They are not overly soft. I will not order again. --- Poor quality from Hue. The quality of these socks is not good. After 3 washings they no longer have the ability to stay where they are supposed to be. These socks become loose and the heel will end up by the ball of your foot after 5 minutes of walking. Go to the store and buy the cheapest socks you can find. You'll be just as happy with you socks. --- Waste of money!!!. I got four pairs of three of the patterns. Seriously such a rip off. False advertising, too.

Examples:
Don't Waste Your Money!. These socks are extremely itchy. There is no way this is Merino wool! The socks are also way too big. I wear a 9.5 and my feet are sliding around in them. (Will definitely cause a blister if I try to hike in them.) And, the socks are already falling down, this is the first time wearing them. Don't waste your money!
---
These socks are pretty mediocre compared to the wigwam brand of merino wool .... These socks are pretty mediocre compared to the wigwam brand of merino wool socks. These are thin and just don't last
---
They seem nice at 1st. They seem nice at 1st, but they just don't have the longevity of other merino wool socks I own. All of them wore out in the heel, while remaining fine everywhere else, must be the type of stiching, as I assume all merino wool is created more or less equal. Won't be buying these again. Spend more on Smartwool or Wigwam, they'll last much much longer.

Label: Unknown
Top Terms: socks, br, wear, pair, sock, better, new, people, br br, good
Examples:
Not Worth The Savings. As many people here, I bought a set of People Socks based on reviews. I got the sense I was buying high-quality American-made lower-cost socks and was willing to try them out. I only wear them a couple months of the year, and mostly weekends, so they don't get heavy use. Out of the box People Socks seem decent, and I liked them so much I bought another set the following year. HERE'S THE PROBLEM:

In 2011, I bought a few Wigwam socks. See link below. They're pricey, hence my next purchases:
2013: Bought a set of People Socks
2014: Bought that second set of People Socks I mentioned earlier.

It's 2016, and guess what: as I write this review, I am wearing a pair of my original Wigwams. ALL of the People Socks I've purchased have worn through the foot and I've thrown them away. By my math I get three times the wear for only twice the cost. I'm not saying you should run out and buy Wigwams, but I CAN tell you that sometimes quality IS better than quantity.

[[ASIN:B000TA74IM Wigwam Men's Hiking/Outdoor Pro Length Sock, Charcoal, Large]]

Bonus: People Socks pill like nobody's business. Wigwams don't. Though this really only seems to be an aesthetic problem, and they mention it on the PS page, but it's worth mentioning. --- Super warm, comfortable socks - They lasted through only TWO wearings!. These socks are incredibly comfortable. I'd say they're right up there with the best socks ever. Why only one star? They ripped completely across the toe seam after only two wearings! Do these socks have some kind of warranty? $17 a pair and they self-destruct after less than a few weeks.

FOLLOWUP: I contacted Wigwam socks directly and here is their reply: "Guruka, please accept our apologies. A replacement pair of socks will be sent. At times a stitch may be missed when the machine knits the toe closing which offers the most comfortable toe seam. Your order number is... Wishing you a safe and healthy holiday. Wigwam.com Customer Service"

So they do stand behind their product. --- What a disappointment!. I had a pair of Wigwam socks for the last 10 years that I absolutely loved. They finally got holes in them so I needed a new pair. Obviously, being so happy with the last pair, I immediately searched for and purchased new Wigwam socks! What a disappointment these new socks are compared to the old ones. They don't fit well (way too tight around the calf, and too loose around the foot)(and I have size 13 wide feet), they're much thinner material than the old ones, and they constantly slip down (floppy toe every time you take your shoes off). I wish I could've returned both pairs but I washed one to see if it got better. Spoiler: it didn't.

I do not recommend the Peoples SOcks.

Label: Unknown
Top Terms: socks, good, quality, great, price, wool, good quality, feet, warm, comfortable
Examples:
Not good. Bad actually.. I wont go as low to say they are garbage, but not far off the mark. They are a little small, a little short, a lot thin, not warm and I'm not the kinda person that gets cold feet easily. Not sure what they are good for... maybe summer...no, to uncomfortable. I'm actually trying to figure out how people suffered thru wearing these long enough to develop holes in them, I couldn't get them off quick enough.  I'm thinking extra socks for the camper or tent in case all your GOOD socks get too wet or dirty these could be a last resort. Or they would make nice toilet paper in an emergency. You could store things in them I suppose. I read the poor reviews and thought, oh people are just being picky, nope they were all accurate. Someone compared them to Haynes socks but I'm pretty sure Haynes are thicker and fit better. Too bad. I really would keep looking. Unless of coarse you need some good toilet paper.
---
Decent for the amount of money. I did not receive all 3 pairs of socks only two.  So make sure to double check you got all your socks . Material of socks expected with the price I paid for them.
---
Not really worth the money. I've only worn once, but I didn't notice anything different from normal good quality socks and they are much more expensive than other socks.
